intro: Ononis avellana, commonly known as the Spanish broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Ononis avellana is often used in landscaping for its hardiness and ornamental value.
